messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Flight Sim question
messages.msgSnippet: ... There was evidence the WTC hijackers used the program to practice flying into the towers.  There was a news report showing how you could crash your plane
messages.messageBody:
on 12/7/01 8:13 AM, Karin at curtkar@... wrote:

> Why were they supposed to take Micro. Flight Sim off the shelfs? Because of
> the WTT visuals? I think I might have heard something about that, too. I know
> that there is a new version out (2002) and the WTT are not in that version.

There was evidence the WTC hijackers used the program to practice flying
into the towers. There was a news report showing how you could crash your
"plane" into them, and I assume into other landmarks as well.

Woo hoo, what fun.

Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Flight Sim question
messages.msgSnippet: I live in Phoenix, AZ. We have lots of KMarts! Why were they supposed to take Micro. Flight Sim off the shelfs? Because of the WTT visuals? I think I might
messages.messageBody:
I live in Phoenix, AZ. We have lots of KMarts!
Why were they supposed to take Micro. Flight Sim off the shelfs? Because of the WTT visuals? I think I might have heard something about that, too. I know that there is a new version out (2002) and the WTT are not in that version.

Karin


----- Original Message -----
From: discovery6@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, December 07, 2001 8:21 AM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Gaming and the Bible Belt



The other day the kids and I were in KMart and they had this software title
(98) for sale. The reason I remember is that my daughter pointed it out
saying, I thought they were suppose to take these off the shelf. Is KMart in
your area?
Candace


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
